column4: Can anyone help - my only user no longer appears to be in the sudoers file, and it's a remote server I can't easily get access to.
that sounds like trouble.
I'm getting that feeling too.
feel like going for a drive ;)?
are you the only user on that box?
There's one other remote user, but he doesn't have any admin access.
You're trying to scare me :)
I'm not, actually. But it's a valid question, no?
Absolutely. I've just checked the forum, I was doing a chgroup command at the time this started. Someone else has reported this problem starting when trying to chgroup
are you still in the admin group?
How do I check?
type 'groups' at a console.
hmmm, it just says timhaughton developer. I just thought I added myself to the developer group. I bet I wiped out my other groups.
that's exactly what happened.
Bugger.
I feel a late night recovery console coming on.
usermod -a newgroup will append the group to your list.. Just for future reference.
yeah I don't think you are going to recover from that without actually being there unfortunately.
root can be a dangerous thing. Especially remote admin. Use the man pages!
I promise to rtfm from now on :(
Still, the 105 mile journey will give me time to reflect on my error :)
we all learn that lesson the hard way. No matter how good at adminning we think we are.
